dialogues.text: A pair of dark, menacing eyes stare into the rearview mir We stay on the mirror as this person steps out of the car We hear the driver's door slam shut.

dialogues.text: We watch on, from the rearview mirror, as this figure wal around the car and to the trunk. He opens the trunk. Fast enough so we can’t get a good look at his face. A few moments pass.

dialogues.speaker: A YOUNG BLONDE WOMAN

dialogues.text: The gagged woman ruffles through the forestry. She cries out, through the cloth. The dark figure walks some distance behind her, silent. Suddenly...he forcefully pushes the girl to the ground. She falls into the mud.

dialogues.speaker: SPLAT
dialogues.text: She quickly turns around, facing her captor. The dark figure kneels down and digs through the filthy m searching for the perfect stick or tree branch. He picks up a long, thick, healthy branch and snaps it in half. He throws the other half back into the dirt and pul out a pocket knife. The girl watches on, a bit confused. He has a seat on a nearby tree trunk and begins using the blade to shave the branch down, sharper and sharper, maki home made weapon of some sort. The young woman simply watches in horror. She attempts to stand, but the dark figure walks over and steps on her ba pushing her face back into the dirt. As the girl lays, face down on the ground, the dark figur continues shaving the tree branch down into a sharp spear The girl watches as shavings from the branch hit the grou all around her. The dark figure grabs her and turns her over, facing him. points the sharp stick directly at her eye. She instantly turns away. He then rubs the end of the stick across her eye lids as SCREAMS out in a panic. Afraid that he’ll puncture her ey the girl tries to lay as still as possible. He simply rubs the stick across her eyes and cheeks, taki in her fear. Enjoying himself. Her eyes remain shut, scared he will pop one of them out his weapon. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark figure reaches back, as if he’s going to drive t stick into her face. Instead, he drives it into the groun as hard as he can. He reaches down and pulls the gag from her mouth. She SCREAMS out in terror. The dark figure slowly slides his hand down the front of pants. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open on a LONG SHOT of a white sidewalk in upper, middle class suburbia. Lots of trees and bushes align the quiet streets. The outskirts of LA.

dialogues.speaker: THE 2ND FLOOR
dialogues.text: From around a corner walks JAKE WINCOTT (13) a strawberry blonde with enough red in his hair and sporadic freckles suggest trouble. He is toting a heavy bookbag, coming hom from school. EXT. WINCOTT HOUSE -— CONTINUOUS Jake opens a white, picket gate and enters the property, responsibly shutting it behind him. He continues into the home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake walks in, shuts the door and drops his heavy books o the floor, immediately running to one of the bedrooms.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Matt! Jake opens Matt’s bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Matt! You here? Jake walks in Matt’s bedroom, kneels down and opens a dra to pull a magazine that reads “Sexy Bikini girls” (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo! Jake runs back into to the kitchen to get a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake hurries over to the fridge and opens, grabbing a lar clear jug of cherry Kool Aid. He shuts the door and instantly notices a white, hand wri letter hanging by a magnet. He rests the jug on a counter and reads. INSERT — LETTER Jake I won't be home until late. Dad says to do your homework and stay out of trouble. DON’T GO

dialogues.speaker: ANYWHERE
dialogues.text: Matt

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Jake doesn’t pay the note any mind and pours himself a la glass of Kool Aid. He takes a huge swig of his drink and walks over to a telephone and message machine in the corn He plays the days messages.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE
dialogues.text: First message... MATT’S VOICE (0.S.) Jake! I know you're listening to this, so now you can’t pretend you didn’t get my note! Just in case you forgot...you’re still on restriction! Dad says we’re both dead if I let you go out, so you better not even think about going to that fag’s house! Jake skips ahead, erasing the message.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE
dialogues.text: Message erased. Next message... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JAKE'S FATHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jake. It’s your father. I take it since you’re not answering the phone, you’re out doing something you shouldn't instead of doing your homework like your mother and I asked. Well I just hope for your sake it’s done by the time your brother gets home. Don't think because we’re not there, we’re not watching you, young man. We’re ALWAYS WATCHING!... Jake angrily punches the button on the machine, erasing t message. Suddenly the phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE'S FRIEND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dude. Stop playing with yourself and pick up the phone. I know you're home. Jake picks up the phone. His friend is on the other line.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE'S FRIEND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE'S FRIEND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Waiting on you. I thought you were coming over.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I said we were meeting at Chrissy’s. Why would I come to your place if her house is closer? JAKE’S FRIEND (0.S.) Yeah, but what if I get there before you? Just come over and get me and we’ll go together.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Alright. But I gotta get back before dark. JAKE’S FRIEND (0O.S.) You will. Just take the short cut like I showed you. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Alright. JAKE’S FRIEND (0.S.) And you better not wimp out this time. Remember what I said. If you don’t ask her to the dance, I will.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Alright, alright! I’11 ask her! Just get off my back! Jake hangs up and chugs the rest of his Kool Aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, now dressed to impress, hurries up a residential sidewalk and approaches a large, wooded area. He runs dow small, grassy slope and ventures deeper into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake scurries through the small forest, maneuvering aroun tree trunks and logs, pushing his way through the sharp branches and wet leaves, snapping and crunching twigs wit his feet and tramping through the filthy mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls into an almost full lot and finds an empty sp Parks. Out of the car steps DETECTIVE DAVID REINHARDT, late 40s, graying hair, aviator shades, cheap sport coat, polo shir and khakis. He glances around suspiciously, as if someone is watching him. He begins into the busy park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several retirees are out for their afternoon walk, couple are walking their dogs, parents playing with their childr Some of them sitting at various picnic tables, others grilling burgers and dogs on the barbecue pits. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt notices an unsavory looking fellow wi white hair sitting on the table top of a picnic bench in near distance. ARCHIE is old, fat and greasy. His white hair is spiked u desperate to appear hip and youthful. His silk shirt, designer slacks and fancy shoes suggest money, but are a too flashy for the time and place. He is busy pounding aw at a hot dog with all the works. Detective Reinhardt begins toward him.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: You're late, cop. Thought maybe you were having second thoughts about that money.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I had some trouble going on at home with my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Trouble, eh? Archie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I bet. Girl like that. Good healthy tatas. Nice culito. All those hard dicks beatin’ down your front door. I know. I had a daughter myself. Never had to worry like you, though. She had the face of a chongo’s culo. She was always home. Archie laughs again.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I got the twelve hundred?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: You waiting on a rainy day? Let's see it. Detective Reinhardt pulls a thick envelope from his coat hands it to Archie, who quickly fans through it, counting Detective Reinhardt looks in both directions, making sure isn't being watched. Archie finishes counting the money. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Pretty expensive habit you got there, cop. You’re starting to make me feel guilty. You should start picking your teams a little more carefully. Either that or start thinkin’ about a career change. Detective Reinhardt looks as if Archie’s touched a nerve. His mouth quivering just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (a growing smile) Wait a minute. Could this be payoff money? Archie slides the envelope under his nose, sniffing it.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Hmm. Dinero sucio. Shame, shame. Archie laughs out loud. Detective Reinhardt turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: See you next week, cop. The detective stops, quickly comes back and gets in the m face.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I want you to stop calling the house. I don’t wanna hear from you. I don’t wanna know you exist. And the next time you make threats over the phone at my daughter...I‘1ll kill you. There's plenty of woods around these parts. Archie loses his cocky grin, looking very intimidated. Detective Reinhardt walks off.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Dave! Tell the wife I said hil (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt turns and stares at Archie, giving hi look of pure hate. He is so upset, Archie’s rendered him speechless. He simply walks off. Archie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake hurries through the forest a bit faster and more confident, now finding his way easier. He stops when he looks up and notices a young BLONDE WOMA hands tied to a tree and gagged at the mouth. She stares up at Jake as she cries out in despair. The back of her shirt has been torn all the way up with a knife. Her bare skin exposed and her bra strap showing. Jake almost doesn’t notice the NAKED MAN standing some distance behind her. He is somewhat hidden from view by t thick shrubbery, but is visibly nude. He is a young, thin man in his twenties, long, curly blac hair. So long, it curtails his face from view. He is wearing rubber gloves and holding a long blade in his han We‘ll call him THE SCARY MAN. The scary man uses the knife to rip off the girl’s bra. S SCREAMS out in a panic. Jake slowly backs up, distancing himself from the scene before he’s noticed. He trips over a thick log and falls into the mud.

dialogues.speaker: SPLAT
dialogues.text: The scary man quickly turns his head, staring directly ov at young Jake. We only see close ups of his eyes and the back of his head as he begins toward Jake. Jake quickly stands and darts off, deeper into the woods. The scary man charges after him. From different camera angles, we see parts of his body as he runs. He’s complet naked. His every move is smooth and robotic. Jake is now snapping through the branches hopping from lo log like he owns these woods. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HELP
dialogues.text: Jake notices a grassy field in the near distance and some people sitting at a picnic table. He runs toward the ligh and out of the woods, into a picnicking area. THE PARK FR BEFORE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake trips and falls down a short hill, onto the soft gra

dialogues.speaker: SOMEBODY HELP
dialogues.text: He quickly stands and continues running across the field.

dialogues.speaker: HELP ME
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt is on his cell phone when he looks up notices Jake running out of the woods towards him.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: HELP!!! HE’S GONNA KILL ME!!!

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I‘1l call you back. He hangs up the phone and begins walking towards Jake. Jake runs as fast as he can toward the detective. He approaches him, almost completely out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: There's a man!...A man in the woods!...He’s naked and he’s with this girl! He’s...he’s attacking her! Quick! Call the police! Detective Reinhardt stares in the direction of the woods.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: He was attacking her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCARY MAN’S P.O.V. He watches Reinhardt and Jake from a distance.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt and Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Look! It’s not what you think! He had a knife! She was tied toa tree! You gotta do something! He’s gonna kill her! Detective Reinhardt loses his slick grin and stares off i the woods.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What’re you waiting on, man! Call the cops!

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt ventures into the woods, searching fo any signs of foul play. He comes across the scene of the erime and stops in his tracks. There is a large blanket rolled out on the ground. A pair old sweat pants and a T-shirt lay on the blanket. Detective Reinhardt smiles as he slowly figures it out.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: The little brat scared them off. Detective Reinhardt begins back towards the park, but sto when he notices what appears to be a pair of rubber glove tossed into the mud. He kneels down to get a closer look. A serious look in hi eyes. He cautiously stares all around him, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt and Jake stand on a sidewalk in front Reinhardt’s car.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Alright. What's your name and where do you live? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Jake.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Jake what?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Wincott. I live on Weatherby. A couple blocks away.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Wincott? (squints a bit) You Dale Wincott’s boy?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No. He’s my uncle. He’s a cop. You a cop? Detective Reinhardt stalls, dodges the question.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Well I’m taking you home. I wanna talk to your parents.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: My parents are in Phoenix until tomorrow. Detective Reinhardt squints a bit, thrown off guard.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: They're out of town. At some funeral. It’s just me and my brother until Friday.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Fine. Where’s your brother?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I don't know. He’s not coming home until late. Detective Reinhardt sighs, frustrated, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Do you have a number where I can reach your parents? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake nods. Reinhardt passenger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake turns detective Detective stares at 13. (2)

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Alright. I don’t want you running around the street like this. You’re coming home with me for now. We'll give your parents a call and let them decide what to do with you.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: My parents said never to go with strangers.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: How old are you? About fourteen?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Thirteen.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Thirteen? That’s old enough to start making your own bad decisions. Now get in the car. gets in. Jake sighs as he halfheartedly gets in the side. They pull away and begin out of the lot. to the detective, studying his eyes. The appears a bit on edge.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You saw something out there, didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You wouldn't be driving me home if you didn’t see something? So what was it? Reinhardt stays suspiciously quiet. He simply the precocious teen. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: It might be something, it might be nothing. I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Oh, I get it. That’s on a need to know basis and I don’t need to know, right?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So you are a cop?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You either are or you aren’t.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I was a cop.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: But not anymore?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Hence the emphasis on the word “was”.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You retired?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I guess you could say that. Jake looks confused, but lays off the detective. He simpl stares out the window. EXT. HIGHWAY — CONTINUOUS Detective Reinhardt's car pulls out of the lot and back o a two lane highway. On the way, they pass by a 1967 Mustang, sitting idle on soft shoulder near the woods. Jake sticks his head out the window, looking back at the Mustang as they speed off down the road. The Mustang starts its engine and follows shortly behind.  15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unseen man grips the steering wheel. A very girly, pin key ring dangles from the ignition. A PICTURE OF THE BLON WOMAN IN THE WOODS hugging her boyfriend is on the ring. The man behind the wheel is shirtless, presumably still naked. THE SCARY MAN. His bare arms turn the wheel right as he follows behind Reinhardt and the boy at a corner st sign. The unseen driver continues following behind the unmarked squad car, keeping a safe distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt's squad car makes a right turn onto a residential street, slowly approaching a large, three sto home. Reinhardt’s house. The car parks against a curb outside of the home. Out ste Detective Reinhardt and Jake. The Mustang slowly approaches the stop sign at the end of street and pulls a U-turn, parking against the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCARY MAN‘S P.O.V. The unseen driver stares down the street at Detective Reinhardt and Jake walking towards the home. They continu into the house. The car speeds off down the street. INT. REINHARDT HOME - CASSIE’S BEDROOM CASSIE REINHARDT (18) short red hair, a sexy gothic punk type, lays on her bed, listening to loud, obnoxious music her IPOD. She angrily takes a pair of scissors to a picture of her her ex-boyfriend MATT WINCOTT, Jake’s older brother. She completely surrounded by other torn photos of her and Mat laying on the bed.  16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt and Jake wander into the living room, near the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Wait here a second. Jake plops himself down on the living room couch, instant turning on the television. Detective Reinhardt begins toward the stairs. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Hey, uh...do you need me to go get your schoolbooks or anything?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Nah. I did my homework already. Jake grabs a jar of peanuts sitting on the table before h and pours himself a handful. INT. CASSIE’'S BEDROOM Detective Reinhardt walks in. Cassie pays him no mind.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Hey! Cassie stares over at him, takes out her ear phones.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: What?! cCan’t you see I’m busy?!

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Come downstairs!

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: What now?! Detective Reinhardt shuts the door behind him. Cassie tos her IPOD aside and angrily crawls out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie fumbles her way downstairs as Detective Reinhardt awaits her at the foot of the steps. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: What? I did all my chores.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I need you to watch somebody for a couple hours. Detective Reinhardt motions toward the living room. Cassi turns and looks at Jake sitting on the couch, watching television and eating peanuts.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No I’m not. He gives Cassie a crumpled up twenty dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: You and the kid can order a pizza. Maybe walk down to the corner and rent some movies or something. You go anywhere, you take Jake with you.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Who is this kid and why am I watching him?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: He was a witness to an attempted rape today. That’s who. This guy chased him with a knife, naked as a jaybird. Scared the shit out of him. This might sound crazy, but I think he might have seen our guy today.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Our guy? As in the guy the cops been after for the last five months?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I think so. His parents are out of town until tomorrow night. His brother’s God knows where. I wanna keep him here and safe until they get back. Cassie squints, a bit confused and unsure. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I gotta call this kid’s parents. Detective Reinhardt begins toward a corner office. Cassie follows behind, looking a bit angry. INT. REINHARDT‘’S OFFICE Detective Reinhardt walks around a desk and opens a drawe pulling out a .45 AUTOMATIC. He checks the magazine for bullets, then slides the clip back in. He sets the gun do on the desk and picks up the phone. Cassie interrupts him

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: What’re you doing? Detective Reinhardt looks up at her, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just take him down to the station?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: You know I can’t go down there. If I step one foot in the door, they’11 have me thrown out.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: But it’s their case now, Daddy. You're not a cop anymore, remember? You have to tell them about this. Detective Reinhardt has a seat and begins dialing.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: You don’t want anyone to know about Jake, do you? That's why you’re keeping him here. You still wanna catch this guy. Detective Reinhardt awaits an answer from the other line he does his best to ignore Cassie.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Isn’t it bad enough they took your badge? You want them to take your PI license too? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Look. I go down there with Jake to give a statement, you think they’re gonna take either of us seriously? A twelve year old skipping through the woods and the ex lead investigator, thrown off the case? They'll bury it as soon as we're out the door. I just wanna make sure this goes through the proper channels.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: When you say the proper channels, you mean Detective Grimes?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Right. And it’s gonna be you and Joe, together again. Back on the streets. Until they take his badge too for involving you in an illegal investigation. Detective Reinhardt puts his finger to his mouth, signali Cassie to be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hello, this is David Reinhardt calling back. Cassie loses her patience and storms out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Again, it’s very urgent you return my call as soon as possible. You can reach me at 626-410-9020. Detective Reinhardt hangs up. Sighs in frustration. He stares in the direction of the doorway, as if Cassie was still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie stands hovered over Jake, arms crossed, watching h closely. He is still chomping away at the jar of peanuts. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is staring back and forth between the television and Cassie, feeling her eyes on him.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I know you, don’t I? Jake looks a bit scared.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Maybe. Detective Reinhardt walks in, car keys in hand.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Alright. I’m leaving. I’1l be back in an hour or two.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: If we go out, I’1ll need my car keys. Holding out her hand, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Nice try. Cassie sighs in disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: It’s been three days.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: You'll get your keys when you go back to school on Monday. And no friends over either. I mean it. I’1l be back as soon as possible. You get him whatever he needs. (to Jake) You keep an eye on her.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I’1l see to it she stays out of trouble, Dave. Cassie gives Jake a dirty look. Detective Reinhardt continues out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks (2)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So what was this I heard about pizza?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: You tell me where I know you from and I'll think about ordering pizza. a bit unsure.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: But you’ll be mad.

dialogues.text: Long story short. My dad‘s a no good, degenerate gambler who's blown my entire college tuition on football. Around the tenth time he couldn't pay his debt, they gave up on threatening his life, so they called the house and threatened me and my mother instead.

But she never did come back. That was a little over a year ago. What can I say? Things have been just dandy since then. es another huge swig of her beer.

When they won, she walked away with a big chunk of it. To pay her back, they made her partner at her firm and helped her buy this place. Of course, my Dad used the rest of the money to bet on football and pay off his other debts. Cassie slams her beer down and continues digging through fridge.

dialogues.text: Jake returns her smile. EXT. SIDEWALK —- CRIME SCENE The bum from before is now laying face down on the sidewa covered in a white sheet, nude and dead. It appears his nose had been broken as blood from his fac seems to have stained the sidewalk. His neck has also bee snapped. His shopping cart sits some few feet away, still on the sidewalk where he left it. Yellow crime scene tape is wrapped around the surrounding trees, blocking off the perimeter. Detective Reinhardt and DETECTIVE JOE GRIMES, black, earl fifties, stand hovered over the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Who was he? Detective Grimes stands and grabs Reinhardt’s arm. He pul him away from the scene as the two men take a short strol the sidewalk. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: So what about the Mustang..?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Missing persons?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: I checked recent case files. It just so happens that a Gretchen Morehouse reported her eighteen year old daughter Linda missing some thirty four hours ago. Any guess on the car she was driving?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: So where are you at on this thing?

dialogues.text: Well. Our guy's killed one victim every month. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE GRIMES (cont'd) Each one going missing, then turning up dead one to two weeks later. All of them found nude and face down in the trunk of their own cars. Literally hours after their death. All asphyxiated. None of the bodies sustaining any kind of visible, physical damage. That means he’s holding them for long periods of time without actually touching them. When he DOES finally finish the job, he keeps it clean. Painless. He also makes sure we find them fast by parking their cars in public places and leaving the trunks open.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: So if he’s not interested in sex, why is he leaving them nude?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: We have a couple theories. One is he can’t get it up. And maybe he gets himself off by watching. The other is he gets off by humiliating the victim. That he’s undressing them post-mortem.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: And what do you think?

dialogues.text: I think our guy’s trying to tell us something.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Like...?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: Like how strong he is. That these prom queen types aren’t worth his time. Think about it. You‘re this lonely kid. You can’t get laid. You've been turned down by every chick in school. So you go pick out the hottest girl in class, stick a knife to her throat and drag her out into the woods for some alone time. Then you make her take her clothes off. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Only you don’t touch her cos you’re better than she is. And you want her to know it.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: Exactly. You just watch her beg. You wanna embarrass her and humiliate her, just like she did to you. But he doesn’t do it quickly. He prolongs it. It’s like the longer he goes without touching these girls, the stronger he gets.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: And what better place than the woods? She could scream her lungs out for hours and nobody would hear.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: And he can’t let her go after what he’s done. So he finds the most humane way of completing the act. He holds them down until they simply run out of air.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: When that becomes boring to him...

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: +.+eHe’ll start hurting them for real. I figure it’s only a matter of time before this kid gets knife happy. A woman in her forties cautiously approaches the men. shut in, quiet house mother type. Her clothes are old and worn. They almost look to have been sewn together with he own hands. This is JANIS ROOKER. Her face is old, tired before her time.

dialogues.text: I’ve been following your case very closely around the time the third girl went missing.

dialogues.text: When my Alex was fifteen, he was expelled from school. He followed this girl into the shower room after class let out. He kept her there for nearly three hours before someone found them. Detective Reinhardt and Grimes share another look.

Detective Grimes rolls his eyes a bit, shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: JANIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They couldn't explain what happened. Neither could Alex. He told me he couldn’t remember any of it.

dialogues.text: (to Janis) This tent. What color was it? EXT. RESIDENTIAL SIDEWALK -— DUSK Cassie and Jake strut up the sidewalk, headed back to the house, carrying a large pizza and a bag of some rented DV movies.

dialogues.text: You are Matt’s brother, aren‘t you? Jake looks up and spots the 1967 Mustang sitting at a cur He stops in his tracks. Jake doesn’t flinch. He simply stands in shock, staring a the pink car. Cassie stops, stares back at him, waiting.

dialogues.text: That’s the car I saw. At the park. Cassie turns and stares down the street.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE

dialogues.text: You mean that car on the curb?

dialogues.text: That’s him. It’s the man from the woods. I know it is. Cassie stares down at the license tag. The word “HOTTIE” the front. She laughs a bit.

dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Linda Morehouse. She's head cheerleader. Her plate says “hottie” just like that one.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: She live around here?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: No. She lives across town. (squints, confused) Nowhere near here, actually.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Does she have short blonde hair? Kind of curly?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You seen her at school lately? Cassie stops. Ponders a bit.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: No. Actually, I heard she missed the pep rally today. Cassie stares up at the Mustang, now a bit scared.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Let's just keep walking. But stay behind me, out of sight. Okay? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jake nods. The two begin up the sidewalk, a bit faster th time. Cassie checks the Mustang car and notices the HEADLIGHTS on.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Shit! Walk faster! Cassie and Jake are now hurrying, almost trotting up the sidewalk. The car pulls away from the curb, inching along the side the street, keeping a steady pace with Cassie and Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He’s following us.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I said stay out of sight. Cassie spots the stop sign ahead. Their street.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: We‘re almost there. When we get to the stop sign, I want you to run like hell to the house. You got it?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I got it. Cassie and Jake are almost to the stop sign as the pink c slows to a halt, waiting for them. They finally reach the corner.

dialogues.speaker: RUN
dialogues.text: Cassie and Jake drop the pizza and movies and make a run it, down the street, headed back to the house. The car speeds around the corner, pursuing them. Cassie turns and spots the car barreling towards them.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Get on the sidewalk! Cassie and Jake run onto the sidewalk, off the street and of harm’s way. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The car speeds toward them, could easily kill them both, tries not to outrun them. He’s simply toying with them. They quickly approach the house and hurry towards the fro door. They run inside and lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie and Jake are out of breath, hiding behind the door They peek out the window and spot the pink car sitting outside with the lights on and the engine running.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Come with me! Cassie grabs Jake by the arm as they run into the kitchen phone charger sits empty.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: The phone’s gone! Where the hell is it? Cassie and Jake both notice that the back door is wide op Someone has broken in. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What about your cell?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Shit! My Dad took it! Along with my keys! (beat) My Dad! Cassie grabs Jake by the arm and pulls him towards the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Come on! They hurry up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie and Jake run into a nearby bedroom. Her fathers. She immediately goes to a corner closet and reaches up as as she can, grabbing a small, leather zipper bag from the shelf. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She unzips it and pulls out a chrome-plated snub nose .38 caliber. She checks the chamber for bullets.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Are you gonna shoot him?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: No. I’m gonna scare him. Come on. Cassie grabs Jake and pulls him with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie and Jake hurry down the steps and approach the fro window. Cassie stares outside at the pink car, lights sti on.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So what’s the plan?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know! Shut up and let me think! Cassie and Jake stand in silence, neither of them coming with any ideas.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Okay. I know what to do. Just stay here by the door. Be ready to open it. Okay? Jake nods.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Here I go. Cassie steps out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie slowly and clumsily begins toward the parked car b the curb, pointing her gun towards it, looking very nervo and unsure of herself.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Alright! The cops are on their way! So you better leave! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The car doesn’t budge one inch.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Right now! (beat) If you don’t...I’m gonna shoot! The car simply sits with the engine running. Not moving.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I mean it! I’m gonna count to three! If you're still here...I'm gonna start shooting! Do you hear me?!l... The car still sitting by the curb.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: One!...Two!...Three!... The car doesn’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Alright! That’s it! I’m coming over there! If you’re still here by the time I get over there...1I‘1l blow your head off! Cassie slowly stumbles over to the parked car, her arms f extended, gun pointed at the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Here I come! (to herself) Oh God, please don’t let me die. Cassie moves closer and closer, walking around the car to driver’s side. She stares into the open window and sees LINDA MOREHOUSE sitting behind the wheel, dead, deep thumb bruises on her neck. Choked to death. Cassie backs up a bit, in shock. An ARM reaches from under the car and grabs her ankle. Cassie trips and falls to the ground, dropping the gun. T gun is tossed a good two feet onto the pavement. The long knife-like fingers of the killer tear at her leg slicing them up. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She struggles to stand as the scary man steps from under car. He hovers over her. Cassie finally manages to stand and darts back toward the house. The scary man slowly strides toward her, slow enough to g her a head start. Before Cassie has a chance to beat on the door, Jake open it, letting her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie and Jake by the door.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: He’s got the gun! Get upstairs! Now! Jake runs up the steps, out of sight. Cassie begins for t garage. She opens a door and runs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie pulls out a large five iron from an old golf bag sitting in a dark corner. She runs back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie heads for the back door to lock it. As she passes through, she looks out the kitchen window and spots THE S MAN passing by. She runs for the back door, trying to beat the killer to She’s too late. THE SCARY MAN enters, holding the .38 snub nose in his ha He slowly begins toward her. He holds out the gun, ready fire. All the color drops from Cassie’s face. She’s a sitting duck. The scary man twirls the gun around on his finger, with t handle now pointing up and out. Pointed at Cassie. Cassie is completely confused by this. She simply stands with the golf club in hand, ready to swing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The scary man walks over to the kitchen counter and sets gun down, with the handle pointed at Cassie, daring her t grab it. He steps a good distance away from it. About as far away from the gun as Cassie is from the gun. Cassie looks back and forth between him and the pistol, contemplating her next move. She makes a run for the star INT. STAIRWAY -— CONTINUOUS Cassie darts up the steps with her golf club, not looking back. On a wall downstairs, we notice the shadow of a man walking towards the staircase, taking his time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie runs down the hall, searching for a place to hide.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Cassie opens one of the side doors, checking inside the r

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Where are you??? Jake opens a door at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Cassie! Over here! Cassie peeks her head around the door frame, noticing Jak the end of the hall. She runs toward him. She runs inside and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scary man struts up the steps, taking his time. He steps off and continues down the hall, checking each o the doors. They are all unlocked. In the other hand he is carrying the .38 revolver. He continues checking the doors until he’s reached the en the hall. He grabs the knob and tries to open. It’s locke  48. INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Cassie and Jake huddle together on the floor, holding eac other tight as they watch the door knob move back and for

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) When he comes in, you hide under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Shhh! The door knob shaking continues a few seconds. Then...sto altogether.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What’s he doing? EXT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM The scary man steps away from the door and opens the cham on the revolver. INSERT — GUN There are six shots left. He empties the bullets into his palm. All six shots.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: He begins tossing them at the door, one by one.

dialogues.speaker: TAP
dialogues.text: Then another...

dialogues.speaker: TAP
dialogues.text: Another...

dialogues.speaker: TAP
dialogues.text: INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Cassie and Jake listen at the tapping on the door. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: What is that? EXT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM The bullets bounce off the door and hit the carpet below.

dialogues.speaker: TAP
dialogues.text: Then another...

dialogues.speaker: TAP
dialogues.text: The scary man quietly begins back down the hallway, away the bedroom. INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Cassie and Jake sitting in complete silence. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What’s he waiting on?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. EXT. WOODS — NEAR THE PARK Detective Reinhardt and Detective Grimes rustle their way through the dirty wooded area, back at the scene of the crime. They come across the blanket spread out on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Here’s where the kid found them. Detective Reinhardt looks all around him, staring into th trees.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: What're we doing here again?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: It’s gotta be around here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: What has to be around here? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: He had to have been camped here for the night. It’s the woods. He’s out of sight. It only makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: Don't you think he would've picked up his stuff and covered his tracks by now? The kid saw him. He's a witness.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Exactly. Between me and the kid, I think we scared him off. I don’t think he had time to come back and collect his things. Just keep looking. The two men venture deeper into the woods. Detective Reinhardt hurries faster and faster through the trees. Detective Grimes trying to keep up. EXT. REINHARDT HOME — NIGHT The 1967 Mustang is still parked out front. INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Cassie and Jake are still holding each other tight. They' barely budged in hours. Day has now fell to night and the are still waiting in terror.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I think he might be gone.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Maybe. Probably. I haven't heard anything. Jake slowly stares up at Cassie, watching her closely.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Cassie?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. What is it? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie doe 51.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: There's something I should probably tell you.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: My brother never cheated on you. He just told you that so you'd break up with him. sn‘t quite care at this point. She is scared stiff. Almost frozen with fear. She simply rolls her eyes at the young boy.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He wanted to start seeing this other girl, but wasn’t real sure how to break things off. He figured if he told you he cheated, you'd never wanna talk to him again. I just thought you should know.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Oh. Okay. I feel a lot better knowing that now, Jake. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I know it sounds crazy. But my brother didn’t wanna hurt you. He just didn’t want you to think it was you. It was him. He just wants to see other girls. That’s all. Cassie grows angrier with every word from Jake’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He doesn’t even believe in cheating. My Dad cheated once. Almost broke up our family. I guess in a way...he lied for you. To spare you. Cassie squints in confusion. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I see. Let me see if I can get this straight. So instead of simply breaking up with me...or being honest and telling me he wanted to see other people...he decided to kick my heart in and embarrass me in front of my friends. All because he wanted to...spare my feelings? Is that what you’re telling me? Jake stares at the wall, pondering it all.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Doesn't make much sense, does it?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Not much. No.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Well. I just thought you should know. Jake stares over at Cassie to see if she’s paying attenti He wants to tell her something. It’s on the tip of his tongue, but can’t seem to spit it out. Something personal

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Sometimes I miss my Dad. He's always working. I’m usually in bed by the time he gets home. Cassie isn’t paying much attention. She simply stares at floor, exhausted. When we do talk, all he ever does is yell at me. I get in trouble a lot at school. This catches Cassie’s attention. She can relate.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: My guidance counselor thinks it’s because of my father. He says I get myself in trouble for attention. He says I like it when my Dad has to leave work to come talk with the principal. Like I’m getting back at him for not paying enough attention to me. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I guess in away. I guess I’ve got a lot of anger issues. Kind of like you. Maybe that’s why you said what you did about my brother and Mrs. Clark. Because you want attention. You want people to feel sorry for you.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Or maybe your brother's just a creep.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So what about you?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Studies have proven that when people go through near death experiences together, they form an unlikely bond. They share their inner most secrets with one another. I told you about my brother and my Dad. So what about you? You have anything to tell me? Cassie looks away from Jake, a bit embarrassed. She slowl comes around.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I miss my mother. Sometimes it’s hard not having a woman around to talk to. It’s because of my Dad that I...well...I haven’t been too good with relationships. You know? Boys? It’s like I have this unconscious hatred for men. It’s like deep down I know they’re all gonna grow up to be irresponsible ass holes like my Dad that drink and gamble and screw around on their wives.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He can’t be that bad. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: My Dad? You don’t know the half of it.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be so hard on him.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Why not?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It's gotta be hard enough on your Dad, being that your Mom’s gone. I think you two should make the best of things and try to get along. Sure would make things a lot nicer around the house. Instead of biting each other’s heads off. But what do I know? I’m just a kid. Cassie turns to Jake, smiles. He’s made a great point and seems to have touched a nerve with Cassie.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t completely honest with you about my mother.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I mean she’s dead. Jake is shocked by Cassie’s secret. He simply stares at t floor. Cassie huf

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: About four months after she split, she was diagnosed with leukemia. A little under a year later, she died. It’s like she just couldn't take it anymore and her body just gave out. fs in pure disgust.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Can you believe that? My own mother was dying and I couldn’t even be there for her. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cassie shakes her head in bitter disgust. Bad memories of her mother’s illness are hitting her like a sack of brick

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: She was always healthy as a horse. Worked out, ran three miles a day. She’d never even been to the doctor. Not once. They told me cancer killed my mother, but I know better. That bastard made her sick. All she did was worry about me. She worried so much, it killed her.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: My grandmother had cancer. She died. Her and my grandfather were married forty five years. They loved each other. Whatever you think your Dad did to your Mom, you shouldn't think that. I’m sure he misses her as much as you.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: When that gun was pointed at me. I thought that was it. That I was never gonna see my Dad again. I remembered what it was like to lose my mother. I got so scared. I guess I have been too hard on him lately.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You guys should have a talk.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. You‘re right. Maybe you and your Dad should talk too.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Only if you do. Cassie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I promise. Jake turns his attention to the door. He watches it carefully.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Why do you think he didn’t kill us? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to know?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: We should check to see if his car is still here.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: It is. I just checked a minute ago. We would have heard it.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Maybe he ran away. All of the sudden there is the sound of FOOTSTEPS coming the hall. The floor creaks a bit.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He‘s coming.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOOTSTEPS STOP AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Cassie spots a YELLOW NOTE being slid under the door. Something written on notebook paper. She carefully walks over and picks it up. It says...

dialogues.speaker: LOOK IN THE HALL
dialogues.text: Cassie shows it to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna check it out.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? Don’t open the door.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Just stay back. Jake hands her the golf club. Cassie slowly opens the door and stares down the hall. CASSIE’S P.O.V. She spots the .38 snub nose laying on the floor in front the bathroom. The gun is all the way at the end of the ha (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cassie stares down at the floor and spots the six bullets scattered all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Cassie steps into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie quickly bends down and begins picking up the shell one by one. She stuffs them in her pocket and shuts the door. INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Stay here. Whatever happens, stay put and keep the door locked.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: To check something.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Forget that. You’re not leaving me here. I’m going with you.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: No you're not.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Yes I am! I’m not staying in here! Cassie is red with anger. She quickly kneels in front of Jake, grabbing him by both arms and jerking him toward he Her eyes wide and focused.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Look. My Dad gave me real simple instructions. And that’s to keep an eye on you until he gets back. If you get killed, I'm never gonna see my cell phone or my car keys again. We don’t have a car...a phone...or a weapon. I think our situation is bad enough without you complicating it. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CASSIE (cont'd) So just sit down and be quiet until I can figure things out. Got it? Jake senses the seriousness in Cassie’s eyes. He backs of

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Good. Now lock the door behind me. Cassie leaves. Jake quickly locks the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie holds up the five iron, ready to strike as she slo shuffles down the hallway. CASSIE’S P.O.V. She watches each door carefully as she makes her way clos to the gun. She comes into view of the staircase. She looks down the steps and spots the scary man, a.k.a. ALEX ROOKER standin near the top. Now branding a steak knife from the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Cassie stares back and forth between him and the gun on t ground. A few moments pass and she forcefully tosses the golf club at his head. He ducks, barely dodging it. Cassie charges after the gun, grabbing it from the floor, is eventually grabbed from behind by Alex. He pushes her against a wall, pulling her arm behind her back, listening to her SCREAM out in pain. He pushes her face into the wall so hard she can barely catch a breath. He slides the tip of the knife up and down her back as sh struggles to breath. He pulls her away from the wall and pushes her into the bathroom. Cassie stumbles to the cold, hard floor. She quickly shut the door on him. INT. BATHROOM — CONTINUOUS Cassie locks the door on Alex. She looks over at the mirr and notices in bright red letters... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NOW WHAT
dialogues.text: Cassie frantically begins searching for weapons. She rummages through the cabinets under the sink and spots a first aide kit.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: -- She grabs a small pair of sucres and stuffs them in he pants. -- Spots a candle sitting on the counter. -- Searching the drawers. Finds an ignitor, the kind used for lighting barbecues. -- She stuffs the lighter in her belt loop as if she was cowboy carrying a gun. -- Spots a can of AIR FRESHENER sitting on the sink. She stuffs that in her pants along with the small scissors. -- Takes off one of her socks. Drops a bar of soap into i Slaps the homemade weapon into her palm, trying it out. EXT. REINHARDT HOME —- NIGHT A CAR slowly pulls to the curb, just a couple houses down from the Reinhardt’s. Out steps

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: The slovenly loan shark from the park. He is branding a small caliber weapon in his belt. He quietly begins towar the Reinhardt house, suspiciously watching his surroundin Checking for witnesses and such. Archie begins around the house, to the back yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie approaches the back door, staring inside. He quiet opens the door and enters. He pulls the weapon from his b and slowly moves through the house, searching for any sig of life. He spots Dave’s office in the corner and begins toward it  60. INT. DAVE’S OFFICE Archie enters. He begins toward Dave’s desk, searching al the drawers. One of the drawers is locked. He uses a knif to jimmy the drawer open. Inside is a small, manila envel filled with loose bills. He gives the cash another good sniff.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Second best smell in the world. Archie looks up, notices the shadow of a man walking past office. He drops the envelope and points his gun in the direction of the doorway. He slowly begins out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie walks out. He turns to the right and begins toward corner bedroom. The door is wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps inside and notices...

dialogues.speaker: A BODY OF A PERSON UNDER THE SHEETS
dialogues.text: He slowly begins toward the bed with his gun pointed at t body.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Nap time’s over, David. He pulls the sheet back. It’s a bunch of pillows. ALEX appears behind Archie. His face curtailed by his lon hair. Archie senses someone behind him and spins around, pointi his gun at Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? Alex simply stands...silent.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Okay. You don’t wanna talk to me? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Archie pulls the hammer back on his gun.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Talk to this. In a blink of an eye, Alex TWISTS ARCHIE’S WRIST AROUND s that the gun is pointed at Archie. Before the gun goes off...

dialogues.speaker: WE QUICKLY CUT
dialogues.text: INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Jake is still waiting patiently. Very still. Then...

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The sound of Archie's weapon going off causes him to jump

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Cassie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie is visibly startled by the gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: (to herself) Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie’s dead body on the carpet. Alex places the gun in pants and begins out, simply leaving Archie on the floor. INT. WOODS —- NEAR THE PARK —- NIGHT Detective Reinhardt and Grimes are now branding flashligh still searching the woods. Detective Reinhardt thinks he spots something in the distance. A green tent. A campsite.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: Will you wait up? I can’t even see where I‘m going. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt walks into the private campsite. Alex tent.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: This is it. Detective Reinhardt inspects the surroundings. -- A small radio. -- An oil lamp. -- A bunch of empty food cans. Soup, beans and weiners, t fish, beef stew. Anything he could've easily stolen from local store. He steps into the tent and spots a stack of recent SCHOOL YEARBOOKS. He flips through one of them, checking a few of the schoo photos. Some of the girls have a red circle around their pictures All beautiful, popular. Some of them with a strike throug the center. He sets the book down and picks up another. The same thin Photos of beautiful young girls with red strikes through their pictures.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Take a look at these. Detective Reinhardt hands Grimes a couple of the yearbook

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: They're from different high schools. All over LA. Where the hell did he get these?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Public records, maybe. Local library. He was camped here for at least a couple nights. He probably relocated for each of the girls.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: But the Morehouse girl doesn’t live anywhere near here.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Did you check the boyfriend? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think her mother said he stayed out this direction. The last she heard, Linda was on her way to her boyfriends the night she disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: He could've followed her here. Set up camp for a couple nights. Enough time to get what he wants from her.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: Where is this kid?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: We've got all his next victims right here. We just gotta figure out who’s next. Detective Reinhardt opens up a Glendale High School yearb and spots a photo of his daughter, circled with a red mar

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I gotta get home, right now.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: What is it? Detective Reinhardt passes him the yearbook as he darts o back into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: I gotta call this in! Detective Grimes takes a look in the yearbook. Spots Cassie’s photo. He hurries after his ex partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie carefully opens the bathroom door and steps out. S looks in both directions. She heads toward the staircase and begins down, quietly. As she reaches the halfway mark, she notices that Alex ha barricaded the bottom of the steps with large furniture. front door two. He’s trapped them in. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) shit! Cassie walks down a few more steps and tries to get a bet look into the living room. She hears someone rummaging around in the kitchen. CASSIE’S P.O.V. She spots the shadow of someone walking around in the kitchen. The LIGHT is on.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Cassie continues watching on. Trying hard to stay out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex frantically searches the pantry for canned goods. Anything for the road. There are kitchen drawers spilled out onto the ground. Various household needs all over the kitchen floor. He quickly fills large garbage bags full of food, can openers, flashlights, batteries. Anything he can find in house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie quietly hurries back up the steps. INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Jake is curled up in the corner, still scared to death. Cassie knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jake? It’s me. Jake runs over and opens.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: He’s in the kitchen. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cassie immediately shuts the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Then let’s make a run for it. We can go out the front and run to the neighbors or something.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: We can’t. He’s got the staircase blocked. The front door too. Even if we make it off the stairs, we still have to get past the door.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What're we supposed to do? We can’t just sit here and wait for him to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: If he wanted to kill us, he would've done it by now.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So what does he want? What is he doing? Cassie’s eyes frantically wander around the room, going o ideas in her head. She stops when she spots a photo of he and her father hanging on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Of course. It’s my Dad he wants. Not us.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I don't get it. I’m the one who saw him. Why would he want your Dad? Cassie grabs Jake by the hand and walks him over to her b They have a seat on the edge.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: My Dad was investigating this murder just before he was kicked off the force. A high school girl. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CASSIE (cont'd) Strangled to death and found in the trunk of her car. She was naked. Jake stares off into the distance, piecing it all togethe

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: There was this kid who the police department liked for it. An ex boyfriend of the victim. A rich kid named Danny Myers. The media hated this kid. He was really arrogant and cocky. He even bragged about how he wished he was the one who killed her. The TV and newspapers made him out to be the killer before all the evidence was in.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I remember. It was all over TV. Your dad was the head detective back then, wasn’t he? Cassie nods.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: They were putting a lot of pressure on my Dad to put him away. When he couldn’t get any evidence against Myers to stick, they did an investigation. They found out he took money from this kid’s parents. Twenty thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: They paid your Dad off?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: My Dad had all these outstanding football debts. He bet a lot back then. Until these men came to the house one night and told him if he didn’t come up with twenty grand by the end of the week, my mother and I would disappear. So he told the Myers, for the right price, he’d bury any evidence connecting their son to the murder. He was desperate. He didn’t have a choice. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: But what about Myers? Did he do it?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: My Dad never liked Myers for the killer. He always thought the real guy was more of a loner. Not popular like this other kid. Someone who wasn’t good with girls. Someone who had either killed before or was gonna kill again. Myers had a clean record. He didn’t fit the profile.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So what happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: To Myers? Nothing. This same killer murdered five other girls since my Dad was thrown off the force. Danny Myers had a solid alibi for all of them. It couldn’t have been him.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So the guy I saw in the woods today was the real killer?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: He must‘ve seen you with my Dad and decided to follow you home.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: But why doesn’t he just kill us and get it over with?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe we’re like his hostages or something. Maybe he’s planning on using us as bait for my father. One thing’s for sure. We just can’t sit here and wait for him to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So what are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: If I can make it to the computer, I can myspace some people for help. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASSIE (cont'd) They can call the police. It’s our best option.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Where’s the computer?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: It's in my dad's office, near the steps.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: But you said...

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I know. I’11 have to crawl over and hope he doesn’t hear me.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: But you're too big. Cassie gives him a dirty stare.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I mean...I‘m smaller. I won’t make as much noise.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: You think you can make it?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I can make it. A lot easier than you.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Here’‘s the plan. You email for help. I don’t care if it’s everyone you know. Just get someone to call the cops. You’re gonna be quiet, sit and wait. And you’re not gonna make a sound. Make sure as soon as you get there to lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Then we wait to see if the cops show.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: And if they don’t? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cassie looks away, thinking it over. She figures it out.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna distract him.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Whatta you mean?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go for the garage. He’ll hear the door opening and come after me. That’s when you make a run for the back door. You keep running to the neighbors and you call for help.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I can probably make it.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: And if you don’t?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I can’t think about that now. (beat) Okay. So is this the plan? Jake stares at the floor, a bit unsure. He takes a huge breath, nervously exhales.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Alright. Let’s do it. I’m ready.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Real quiet. Let’s go. Cassie and Jake quietly begin out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie and Jake slowly begin back down the steps. Cassie peeks over the railing, checking for Alex. CASSIE’S P.O.V. She spots him eating something in the kitchen, with his b turned to her. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Okay. He’s not looking. You're gonna have to go now.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I’m scared.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I know, but you have to go now. It‘ll be okay, just be quiet. Jake begins crawling over the side of the railing. He kno over a potted plant, sitting on a small end table. It erashes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Jake panics, drops to the ground and runs for the office. Alex reaches his hand through the railing and grabs Cassi leg, pulling at her. She kicks his hand away. Cassie spots the five iron club, still sitting on the ste and grabs it. She holds it like a baseball bat, ready to swing, but Alex is gone. Nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: JBRKE
dialogues.text: Jake shuts the office door behind him.

dialogues.text: Jake locks the door and runs over to the computer at the desk, has a seat. A bright screen saver glows on the monitor, the system already booted up. Jake grabs the mouse and stares down at the desk. Notices message written on yellow note pad. It says...

dialogues.speaker: NICE TRY. NEXT TIME, YOU DIE
dialogues.text: It’s sitting in the same spot where the keyboard used to BA look of complete panic on Jake’s face. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: Suddenly, Alex breaks open the door and walks in, brandin the large steak knife. Jake jumps off his seat, attempts to hid behind the desk, Alex is quick to snatch him up. He holds Jake as his hostage, putting the knife to his neck and walking him ou the office.

dialogues.text: Alex and Jake continue back into the living room. The tip the sharp knife at Jake’s jugular.

dialogues.text: Cassie spots Alex and Jake walking across the living room lays low. She waits until they pass by, out of view of th stairway. Cassie then quietly crawls over the railing. She drops to the floor and crawls across it like a soldier in combat, holding the golf club in her arms like a rifle. Cassie peeks around a corner wall, searching for Alex and Jake. She looks into the living room and kitchen. They are nowh to be found. She slowly stands up, keeping her back firmly on the wall takes another look. Still nothing. In the open background, we wait for Alex to pop up behind her. We keep waiting, but he never shows. Cassie moves back toward the staircase, being very slow a very quiet. She walks around the bottom of the steps and back toward kitchen, golf club in hand, ready to take a huge swing. I is strangely quiet, no sign of Jake or Alex. Hiding behind a nearby wall, waiting, is Alex and Jake. T problem is, we don’t know where this wall is. Jake’s mout has been duct taped shut. He can’t make a sound. The knif still to his throat. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: Cassie moves into the kitchen area. She notices the pantr door is wide open. The look on her face suggests Alex is waiting for her in there. Alex leaves her, headed out of the garage and upstairs. H shuts the door behind him. Cassie grunts even louder, knowing that Jake is done for.

Jake hurries down the steps toward him, still holding the iron. He attempts to hit him again, but... Alex starts coming around. He holds his knife out ina threatening pose, ready to defend himself. He holds his breath, try to lay as still and quiet as possible. Alex's legs stay dormant. He simply stands, surveying the room, then...after a few moments...finally steps out. Jake shuts his eyes, sighing in relief. He keeps his eyes shut, scared beyond belief. He finally composes himself a opens his eyes. He stares out in the hallway, searching f Alex. JAKE'S P.O.V. Nothing. No Alex, not even a sound.
