dialogues.text: Jake stands near the living room with his hands in his pockets, looking completely exhausted. Doyle and his girlfriend LUCY (20s) a dark vixen dressed short black skirt, black fishnets, a revealing top and bl leather boots, stare at the television in a stuper. Doyle’s feet are kicked up on a coffee table. Lucy’s legs are sprawled out over Doyle’s lap. Doyle pays her no mind. Lucy keeps herself busy by rubbing her hands through Doyl chest hair. She glances over at Jake, giving him a seduct wink. Jake sports a fake smile for the accommodating neighbors. looks away in embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie calls her father from the neighbors phone. She let it ring, over and over.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Come on, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly move over from The Reinhardt home to the Detective’s car. We hear a CELL PHONE RINGING. We slowly move in through the driver’s side window. INT. REINHARDT’S CAR Detective Reinhardt’s cell phone sits rested on his dashboard. It LIGHTS UP as Cassie’s call goes through, unanswered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt discovers all of the furniture blocki the staircase and the front door. A look of pure fear on face. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: He moves further into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt quickly does a sweep of the first flo going room to room. He then moves back toward the stairca

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWAY
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt moves his way past the furniture and the stairs. INT. REINHARDT’S CAR Detective Reinhardt‘s CELL PHONE CONTINUES TO RING. The driver’s side door opens and a hand reaches in to grab it It’s ALEX. EXT. REINHARDT’S CAR Alex answers the phone, not speaking, but listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie listens on the other line.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Daddy?! No answer.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: It’s Cassie. Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: MATCH CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. REINHARDT’S CAR Alex hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie on the other line. Her father’s phone hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Daddy? Hello? Cassie quickly re-dials.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Shit. EXT. REINHARDT HOME —- BACKYARD Detective Grimes passes by the backyard swimming pool, searching all around him. He notices the back door is open. His CELL PHONE RINGS. T caller ID says DAVE REINHARDT

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: Hey, partner. How you doin’ in there? No answer.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: Hey, You there? Alex hangs up. Detective Grimes calls back. He hears the sound of Reinhardt’s CELL PHONE RINGING behind him. He immediately turns.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: Hey, man, I found... He stops mid sentence when he notices his ex partner is nowhere to be found. GRIMES P.O.V. He looks down and spots Detective Reinhardt’s cell phone laying on the cement, near the deep end of the pool. It’s still ringing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Detective Grimes drops his phone and grips his gun with b hands. He begins toward the phone and picks it up. The caller ID says JOE GRIMES.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRIMES
dialogues.text: What the hell?... He turns back around and...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is waiting. He drives a knife into Grimes stomach. BLOOD literally gushes from his stomach and onto the pavement. Alex tosses the bleeding cop into the deep end of the poo

dialogues.speaker: SPLASH
dialogues.text: Grimes body floats like a buoy on the water. Alex continues into the house through the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt discovers Alex’s message on the bathr mirror.

dialogues.speaker: NOW WHAT
dialogues.text: He quickly walks out, moving on to the next room. Detective Reinhardt spots Cassie’s bedroom door open and walks toward it.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Cassie, honey! It’s your father! INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Detective Reinhardt spots the yellow notebook paper on th ground. He picks it up. It reads...

dialogues.speaker: LOOK IN THE HALL
dialogues.text: He suspiciously looks behind him, a bit scared.  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sits on the couch watching television with Doyle and Lucy. He stares into the kitchen at

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: who is desperately still trying to reach her father. She hangs up and quickly dials 911.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: 911 operator? What’s your emergency?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I need you to send someone to 1014 Perkins Drive. A man’s broken into our house. Lucy slowly turns around on the couch, staring over at Ca and looking very concerned.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (to Doyle) Oh my God, Tommy. Did you hear that? Somebody busted into their house. Doyle's eyes are shut. He’s drifting off into a deep slee and couldn’t care less.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmmm. That's nice. Cassie on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Is this man still in your home?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: No. He’s in the driveway. We stabbed him. I'm pretty sure he’s dead. Doyle turns around, facing Cassie.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: (to Cassie ) What the hell’s going on over there? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cassie hangs up. Approaches Jake in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Do me a favor and stay here for a minute. I wanna check something.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You're not going back out there!

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I’m not going far. Just stay here, okay? Promise me you won’t move. Cassie continues out. Jake is visibly scared for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie begins down the street, slowly and cautiously. CASSIE’S P.O.V. Cassie looks to her left, then right. Paranoid that Alex will pop out at any second. She spots her father’s car in the near distance.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Cassie smiles and begins running toward her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie approaches her house. Her father’s car parked out front. A look of pure relief on her face. She moves close to the house and into the driveway. She is completely shocked to see that ALEX is now gone.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Daddy! Cassie runs over to her father’s car and reaches inside. begins HONKING THE HORN.

dialogues.speaker: DADDY
dialogues.text: INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Detective Reinhardt hears the honking of the horn and wal ever to Cassie’s window, stares down at her. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Cassie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassie notices her father standing at her window.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Down here, Daddy! INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Detective Reinhardt smiles, knowing she’s safe. In the background, a bit out of focus, is Alex. He stands waiting for the cop to turn around. Detective Reinhardt opens up Cassie’s window and yells ou

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Up here, baby! EXT. REINHARDT‘’S CAR Cassie stares up at her father.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Get outta there! He’s in the house! INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Alex still stands, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Take Jake and the truck and get outta here! Get as far away from here as possible! Alex slowly begins toward him. He holds back his knife ha ready to drive it into Reinhardt.

dialogues.speaker: JANIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Alex!!! Stop!!! Detective Reinhardt pulls his gun and spins around, befor Alex can even react. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alex simply stands frozen, branding the knife in his hand He pays his mother no mind, but refrains from making a mo on Reinhardt.

dialogues.speaker: JANIS
dialogues.text: stands some two feet into the hallway. She is holding a g on her son. A small caliber, .38 snub. She slowly and cautiously walks into the bedroom. Alex slowly lowers his knife, still staring at Reinhardt who is holding his weapon on him, ready to fire.

dialogues.speaker: JANIS
dialogues.text: Just look at what you're doing! You broke into these nice people's home! You‘ve frightened their children! For what? They haven't done anything to you, have they?! What do you want from them?! Alex once again raises his knife, ready to attack Reinhar

dialogues.speaker: JANIS
dialogues.text: ALEX!!! LOOK AT ME!! Your mother is speaking to you!!! I know you're in there! I know you can hear me! What have you done?! Alex once again lowers his weapon and stares over at Jani

dialogues.speaker: JANIS
dialogues.text: I know you hurt all those girls, Alex. But I stayed quiet. I stayed quiet a long time. Thinking that I could somehow...bring you back to me. I stayed up every night praying, on my knees, you'd come back. But it’s too late now, Alex. You’ve gone too far and I can’t protect you anymore. But I can make it right. This ends right now. Alex completely lowers his knife. He slowly releases it a it hits the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: JANIS
dialogues.text: That’s it, Alex. Come to mother. Detective Reinhardt slowly begins toward his suspect. Rea to throw him to the floor. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alex quickly grabs Janis’s gun hand and twists her wrist around so that the gun is now pointing at her face. He th grabs her by the throat and pushes her back into the hall Detective Reinhardt charges after them.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Alex throws his mother against a wall and puts the gun un her chin. She SCREAMS out in a panic. Detective Reinhardt charges around the corner and puts hi gun to Alex's temple. He squeezes off a shot.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: Alex’s BLOOD covers Reinhardt and Janis’s face as Alex's dead, limp body drops to the floor. Janis SCREAMS out in horror. Blood curdling screams! Her only son is dead.

dialogues.speaker: JANIS
dialogues.text: NO! OH GOD! NO!!II!! Nollitt

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt stares down at the young boy in compl shock. His jaw completely dropped to the ground. He is absolutely sickened by what he’s done. Janis continues screaming out uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt's body almost goes limp as he falls against the wall and slowly drags to the floor. His gun falling out of his shaking hand. He huffs away in complet exhaustion. The sound of POLICE SIRENS is heard in the b. Patrol cars are pulling into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Reinhardt builds him, Cassie and Jake a boloney sandwich. He finishes spreading a bit of mayo on his brea and licks his finger. Cassie walks in, looking a bit refreshed from the night before. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I made some lunch for you and the squirt.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: He’‘s been in the bathroom for damn near twenty minutes. Cassie stares over at the bathroom door across the room, closed. She smiles. Laughs a bit. Detective

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: He must‘ve found a magazine he liked.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Never mind. Reinhardt hands Cassie her plate. A boloney sandwich and some potato salad on the side. She takes a bite. Detective sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: So. Why don’t you let me drive him home?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: I should probably talk to his parents, face to face. Don’t you think they're gonna have some questions?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but. The kid’s still grounded. I figured his parents are gonna be pissed he left the house. I thought after what we've been through last night, he could use the break. I thought maybe we could go hang out somewhere. Reinhardt smiles. Takes a chomp out of his (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I bet. You wanna talk to him about Matt.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: So? I just wanna know if I still have a chance. That’s all.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: And this is the same Matt who ran around on you with some other girl from school? You know how I feel about this kid.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: He didn’t cheat on me, Dad. He just told me he did so I‘d break up with him.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: You sure you two should even be together?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Maybe. I think it might be worth another shot. Detective Reinhardt shakes his head, gives up and takes another bite of his boloney.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Don’t make it too easy for him.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I‘ll try not to.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: What the hell. I guess you could use some time out of the house. Cassie smiles. A toilet flushes in the background. Out steps Jake. Detective Reinhardt and Cassie both turn, staring at him. Jake stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Did you wash your hands? Detective Reinhardt winks at Cassie. Cassie bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Why is everyone laughing at me? EXT. REINHARDT HOME —- DRIVEWAY - DAY Cassie and Jake walk out of the garage and over to Cassie car, sitting in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So since you're driving me home, you thinking about going to see my brother?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Now why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Because after last night, you've learned life is too short and too precious to hold stupid grudges against people. And sometimes it’s just easier to admit when you're wrong. Cassie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I bet you think you're pretty smart, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No. This is just common sense stuff.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: So how about you? You think I deserve a second chance?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Not really. But you’re hot. Hot goes a long way. Cassie smiles, runs her hands through his hair and smacks on the butt. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASSIE (CONT’D) Okay, smart guy. Get in. Jake continues around the car.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You know what, Cassie?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: What?
I don't think I'll be watching any scary movies for awhile. Jake crawls in the car.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me either. Cassie gets in the driver’s side. They pull away from the house and down the street. We watch as the car slowly disappears around the corner stop sign.

dialogues.speaker: CAST
dialogues.text: Dave Reinhardt MARTIN KOVE Cassie Reinhardt HEATHER TOCQUIGNY Jake Wincott BOO BOO STEWART Joe Grimes BRIAN THOMPSON Tom Doyle JEFF CONAWAY Archie “The Bookie” DANNY TREJO Doyle’s girl VIKKI LIZZI FADE TO BLACK. (CONTINUED )
